content.description: Starting with left hand in the large 5 ft high pocket, climb the face trending slightly right following the pockets and edges.Problem #159 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P5.
content.location: West end of area, just right of center of west face.

content.description: Climb up the face left of the 5 ft high large pocket, starting with the thin oval pocket. May take a couple tries to figure out what to use since a lot of the good looking holds from the ground turn out to be not so good.Problem #158 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P4.
content.location: West end of area, center of west face.

content.description: Climb the face just right of the rock on the ground, avoiding the large chunky stuff to the right. The holds to use are pretty obvious (especially compared to its neighbor problem around the corner to the right), good balance and technique will send it.Problem #157 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P4.
content.location: West end of area, north face right of a large rock next to the boulder.

content.description: Pretty much a one-move problem... get established with a left pinch and right side pull, and huck for the horizontal crack. Easy top out afterwards.Problem #150 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P3.
content.location: West face below large horizontal crack in central part of area.

content.description: Starting with left side pull on left arete and right high chunky/pinch hold on right arete, follow the two aretes that angle towards each other to the top.Problem #148 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P4.
content.location: Central part of area, NW corner of boulder.

content.description: Just right of the arete, start with left hand in low pocket, right pinching a wide-ish raised bit, and head up staying left of the large pocket (guide says it is off, but flows nicely if used if you don't mind not getting the full value rating... variation!).Problem #149 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P4.
content.location: West face in central part of area.

content.description: PNW style, don't let the moss deter you! Left of the arete on north face, starting with high left hand and right in a nice pocket, climb up past the moss (holds are clean) to an easier finish.Problem #147 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P3.
content.location: Central part of area, north face right of a crack.

content.description: Start with two pockets about 3 ft apart at 6 ft high, and follow nice edges to the top.Problem #146 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P3.Also the quickest way off the boulder, downclimb edges and drop down to pad.
content.location: East face of boulder in central part of area.

content.description: Time to get technical! Climb the fractured face using the discontinuous larger cracks on the left and small pockets/thin face holds just right of them.Problem #143 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P4.Quickest way off the boulder is to downclimb edges on problem #146 and drop down to a pad.
content.location: South face of boulder in central part of area, in the passageway created by three boulders.

content.description: A number of problems on freestanding boulders in the wash half way between Davey Jones Locker and Atlantis #2. It consists of a couple groups of rounded boulders on the east side, and a large boulder with a "mini-cave" on the west end.
